marklogic.body: Large open buildings such as chapels are notorious to Heat and ventilate without making a lot of noise. Things that look great on paper don't Always translate well to the real world. You can't just scale up plans of a smaller building and expect everything to work as expected. So they stick with the design that works.Â There is also the issue with acoustics. Try speaking in a poorly designed large room and the echos make it impossible for people to hear and understand what is being spoken without over amplification.
